quote: Ambition breaks the ties of blood, and forgets the obligations of gratitude.
Ambition and love are the wings to great deeds.
Ambition can creep as well as soar.
Ambition is the last refuge of the failure.
Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
Ambition is not a vice of little people.
A man without ambition is like a bird without wings.
A slave has but one master. An ambition man, has as many as there are people who helped him get his fortune.
All sins have their origin in a sense of inferiority otherwise called ambition.
Ambition - it is the last infirmity of noble minds.
Ambition breaks the ties of blood, and forgets the obligations of gratitude.
Ambition and love are the wings to great deeds.
Ambition can creep as well as soar.
Ambition is the last refuge of the failure.
Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
Ambition is not a vice of little people.
A man without ambition is like a bird without wings.
A slave has but one master. An ambition man, has as many as there are people who helped him get his fortune.
All sins have their origin in a sense of inferiority otherwise called ambition.
Ambition - it is the last infirmity of noble minds.
Ambition can creep as well as soar.
Ambition can take the place of everything - even sex.
Ambition if it feeds at all, does so on the ambition of others.
Ambition is a lust that is never quenched, but grows more inflamed and madder by enjoyment.
Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.
Ambition is an idol, on whose wings great minds are carried only to extreme; to be sublimely great or to be nothing.
Ambition is like love, impatient both of delays and rivals.
Ambition is not a vice of little people.
Ambition is not what man does... but what man would do.
Ambition is pitiless. Any merit that it cannot use it finds despicable.
Ambition is so powerful a passion in the human breast, that however high we reach we are never satisfied.
Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.
Ambition is the grand enemy of all peace.
Ambition is the last refuge of failure.
Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
Ambition never comes to an end.
Ambition often puts Men upon doing the meanest offices; so climbing is performed in the same position with creeping.
Discontent follows ambition like a shadow.
Every man has, some time in his life, an ambition to be a wag.
Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
I had ambition not only to go farther than any man had ever been before, but as far as it was possible for a man to go.
I had no ambition to make a fortune. Mere money-making has never been my goal, I had an ambition to build.
I have no ambition to govern men. It is a painful and thankless office
I've got a great ambition to die of exhaustion rather than boredom.
If boyhood and youth are but vanity, must it not be our ambition to become men?
If your energy is as boundless as your ambition, total commitment may be a way of life you should seriously consider.
It is my ambition to say in ten sentences; what others say in a whole book.
It is the constant fault and inseparable evil quality of ambition, that it never looks behind it.
Oh that I were seated as high as my ambition, I'd place my naked foot on the necks of monarchs.
Some slaves are scoured to their work by whips, others by their restlessness and ambition.
That which is given with pride and ostentation is rather an ambition than a bounty.
The common faults of American language are an ambition of effect, a want of simplicity, and a turgid abuse of terms.
The incentive to ambition is the love of power.
The men who succeed are the efficient few. They are the few who have the ambition and will power to develop themselves.
The preserve of ambition and folly in pursuit of illusion, or delusion.
The same ambition can destroy or save, and make a patriot as it makes a knave.
Though ambition in itself is a vice, it often is also the parent of virtue.
Time is the only critic without ambition.
To make converts is the natural ambition of everyone.
When ambition ends, happiness begins.
Where there are large powers with little ambition... nature may be said to have fallen short of her purposes.
Ambition should be made of sterner stuff.
